get.description:
STP(Spanning tree protocol) configuration. STP is a network protocol that prevents
layer 2 loops and broadcast storms in Ethernet networks.It does this by selectively
blocking some ports and allowing others to forward traffic

get.summary: Read existing STP Configuration for given name.

patch.summary: Update existing STP configurations for given name.

delete.summary: Delete STP configurations for given name.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaStp_StpSchema.description:
STP(Spanning tree protocol) configuration. STP is a network protocol that prevents
layer 2 loops and broadcast storms in Ethernet networks.It does this by selectively
blocking some ports and allowing others to forward traffic

bpdu-guard-enable-timer.description:
To re-enable timeout after receiving an unauthorized
BPDU(Bridge Protocol Data Units)

bpdu-throttle.description: BPDU(Bridge Protocol Data Units) throttle value in packets per second.

x-enumDescriptions.STP_COMPATIBLE: The protocol operates as STP on all ports.
x-enumDescriptions.RSTP_OPERATION:
The protocol operates as Rapid STP on all ports except those ports where
a system that is using 802.1d Spanning Tree has been detected.
x-enumDescriptions.MSTP_OPERATION:
The protocol operates as Multiple STP on all ports where compatibility to
the old STP protocol versions is not required.

config-name.description: Multiple Spanning Tree (MST) region configuration name

config-revision.description: Multiple Spanning Tree (MST) region configuration revision number

x-enumDescriptions.RPVST: Rapid per VLAN spanning tree mode.

mode.description: Mode of operation for spanning tree protocol.

forward-delay.description:
The wait time for device while transitioning from listening to learning
and from learning to forwarding states.

hello-time.description: Time between messages transmission when the switch is root.

ignore-pvid-inconsistency.description:
Ignore PVID (Port VLAN ID) inconsistencies and allow RPVST(Rapid Per VLAN Spanning Tree)
to run on mismatched links.

max-age.description: Maximum age of received STP information before it is discarded.

max-hops.description: Max hops value for the Multiple spanning tree.

x-enumDescriptions.8021D: Calculate default path cost for ports based on IEEE 802.1d.
x-enumDescriptions.8021T: Calculate default path cost for ports based on IEEE 802.1t.
x-enumDescriptions.PROPRIETARY: Calculate default path cost for ports based on a private standard.

mstp-pathcost.x-typeDescription: Standard to use when calculating the default pathcost.
mstp-pathcost.description: Standard to use when calculating the default pathcost for MSTP mode.

x-enumDescriptions.8021D: Calculate default path cost for ports based on IEEE 802.1d.
x-enumDescriptions.8021T: Calculate default path cost for ports based on IEEE 802.1t.
x-enumDescriptions.PROPRIETARY: Calculate default path cost for ports based on a private standard.

rpvst-pathcost.x-typeDescription: Standard to use when calculating the default pathcost.
rpvst-pathcost.description: Standard to use when calculating the default pathcost for RPVST mode.

cst-log-state-transitions.description: Enable log state-transitions for the instance (CST).

priority.description: Device priority. For CX and PVOS this value will be multiplied by 4096.

rpvst-mstp-interconnect-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
rpvst-mstp-interconnect-vlan.description:
RPVST-MSTP(Rapid Per VLAN Spanning Tree - Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol)
interconnect VLAN.

root.description: Root for the PVST(Per VLAN Spanning Tree) instance.

transmit-hold-count.description:
To set the maximum number of BPDUs(Bridge Protocol Data Unit)
per second that the switch can send from an interface

x-enumDescriptions.ERRANT_BPDU: Enable notifications which are sent when an errant bpdu is received.
x-enumDescriptions.LOOP_GUARD: Enable notifications which are sent when loop guard inconsistency occurs.
x-enumDescriptions.NEW_ROOT: Enable notifications which are sent when a new root is elected.
x-enumDescriptions.ROOT_GUARD: Enable notifications which are sent when root guard inconsistency occurs.

items.description: Enable MSTP/PVST(Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol/Per VLAN Spanning Tree) traps.

topology-change-trap.description:
Enable topology change notification for the MST(Multiple Spanning Tree)
instance 0 (CST)(Common Spanning Tree).

mstp.description: List of STP parameters applicable per MSTP instance.

instance-id.description: Instance identifier for the MSTP instance.

priority.description: Device priority. For CX and PVOS(AOS-S) this value will be multiplied by 4096.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description: List of VLANs for MSTP instance.

root.description: Root for the Multiple Spanning Tree (MST) instance.

topology-change-trap.description: Enable topology change notification for the specified MST instance.

instance-log-state-transitions.description: Enable logging of state-transitions for the given instance-id.

rpvst-auto-enable.description:
This command enables/disables the RPVST Auto VLAN feature.
Default priority of 8*4096 will be assigned to the VLANs being auto created.
In 'auto-vlan-enable' RPVST mode, the maximum number of RPVST instances that
can be activated for VLANs within the switch is determined by the switch's
capacity in terms of both the maximum number of supported VLANs and the vport limits.

rpvst-auto-priority.description:
The priority value configured for the RPVST Auto VLANs.
Set the priority value as a multiplier of 4096. Default is 8.

rpvst.description: List of STP parameters applicable per PVST(Per VLAN Spanning Tree) instance.

vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

enable.description:
Enable RPVST on the specified VLANs.
CX specific behavior:
   rpvst[{"vlan": 10, "enable": true}] yields below commands.
      no spanning-tree vlan 10 disable
      spanning-tree vlan 10

priority.description: Device priority. For CX and PVOS(AOS-S) this value will be multiplied by 4096.

forward-delay.description: Forward delay time in seconds for the RPVST(Rapid Per VLAN Spanning Tree) instance.

hello-time.description: Hello time in seconds for the RPVST(Rapid Per VLAN Spanning Tree) instance.

max-age.description: Maximum age time in seconds for the RPVST(Rapid Per VLAN Spanning Tree) instance.

root.description: Root for the PVST(Per VLAN Spanning Tree) instance.

topology-change-trap.description:
Enable topology change notification for the specified PVST
(Per VLAN Spanning Tree) vlan id.

vlan-log-state-transitions.description: Enable logging for state-transitions for the vlan

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

bpdu-guard-enable-timer.description:
To re-enable timeout after receiving an unauthorized
BPDU(Bridge Protocol Data Units)

bpdu-throttle.description: BPDU(Bridge Protocol Data Units) throttle value in packets per second.

x-enumDescriptions.RSTP_OPERATION:
The protocol operates as Rapid STP on all ports except those ports where
a system that is using 802.1d Spanning Tree has been detected.
x-enumDescriptions.MSTP_OPERATION:
The protocol operates as Multiple STP on all ports where compatibility to
the old STP protocol versions is not required.

config-revision.description: Multiple Spanning Tree (MST) region configuration revision number
